intro: Chomelia sambucina, commonly known as the redwood tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its tall, straight trunk and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Chomelia sambucina is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
